Even as Hydras stood welcoming in the possible dangerous Scourge and Cyclon=
us, the individual that used to be the Autobot Rodimus Prime stood brooding=
. While he may have looked something like the old Rodimus Prime, his colors=
 were darker, black the old Rodimus was red, and a white hot flame on his c=
hest, rather then the yellow. His weapons and form look sharp, sleeker and =
more meancing as he stood with his arms folded over his chest, his optics f=
ocused on a particular target. 

Through thick protective glass Dark Rodimu=
s could see the form of Nightlight, who at the moment lay unconscious in he=
r cell. His thoughts were dark and moody as he observed her, he could see t=
he low level pulsing of energon flowing through her system as she lay there=
. 

On one level he knew that she was his wife and the mother of a child - =
HIS child. He had trouble grasping that. He knew some of these things, but =
it was as if these memories belonged to someone else, some other Rodimus. T=
hey held no emotional attachment to him - and yet here he was standing here=
 watching her and not knowing what to do. 

He hated not knowing what to do=
. A glanced away and looked over at the lift doors, as he figured Hydras wo=
uld be waiting for him in the throne room. Yet there was something that had=
 pulled him here. 

With a scowl he turned away from Nightlight and began w=
alking towards the lift, he would worry about it later. Right now he had bi=
gger fish to fry. 

With a last glance back at Nightlight he began to walk.=
 

Preston
(Rodimus)
